intro: Thrixspermum incurvicalcar, commonly known as the hooked thrixspermum, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring tendrils that curve inward, which aid in climbing and support. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds. Thrixspermum incurvicalcar is native to specific regions in South America and is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments.
